turns.text: Well Ill tell you why I feel so - I feel strongly about this topic I dont know whole lot about the immigration laws But I do know that in the where I live and I teach school there are so many Orientals that have come here and theres lot of Mexican people too Which is not neither here nor there but the fact is that all the Orientals that are here are very affluent uh very wise in money matters and have ta- have taken over lot of businesses and have - Really ki- - its kind of scary because theyre so bright Theyre all the kids that I have that are Oriental are really far above the American kids And they - and the the parents are unbelievable because they are just on the way up And money is their main goal And its - it really is kind of scary because theres theres just oodles of them And you can not believe the businesses and corporations that have been taken over by Orientals And its - its kind of scares me not that I dont want them here and not that I dont appreciate the fact that you know that they have rights too But on the other hand you feel like almost theyre theyre invading us to the point where theyre going to take over
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right Actually my son once said that that perhaps uh what we should do is is buy little square of land some place in the Midwest And and that might be the solution
turns.label: aa

turns.text: I think probably thats good idea
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Because I lived in Iowa for for about ten years before I came here And I was born in Ohio
so it it really - and there is there are lot of Mexican people here because were so close to the border

And and they are wonderful people and and Im not you know I dont want to deny them their rights Just that you you feel like when you were born and raised here and you worked re- very hard to make this country what it is uh it scares you when you feel like somebodys taking over And lot of these people plan one day to go back you know to to Vietnam or to you know Taiwan or wherever theyre from And take with them lot of American dollars plus lot of power in American com- com- companies And its kind of scary
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And you know I dont know I dont know the immigration laws that uh that - well and I do not and in fact I dont know them at all I dont know how many people they allow in the United States per year or if theres even - I dont even know if there is number that they allow in anymore Do you know anything about that
turns.label: h

turns.text: No I dont I dont know I lived in the Middle East for sometime and I I --
turns.label: nn

turns.text: -- do believe there must have been some sort of quota system because uh I know lot of people that were in sense not qualified is the wrong word but certainly were deserving to come
And it seemed to take them long time or or there was lot of uncertainty as to whether they would be able to come
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And so I would guess that you know there are quotas for different places
turns.label: sv

turns.text: I would think so too It -
turns.label: aa

turns.text: You know I I I think theres something about being able to to claim um imminent danger or Im not sure what the terminology is
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah There there you go You got the term
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And maybe thats an issue with lot of people I dont know But
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah I I guess I havent been in situation where its its been threatening to to me Uh

Well I teach in the suburb of Dallas and and uh my kids go to school in another suburb of Dallas And with very very good school systems And theyre considered you know one of the top three in the state Both of them you know
And it seems like lot of the Orientals make sure that their kids go to these schools
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And theyre head and shoulders above lot of the kids here And the kids in this area are very bright And come from you know parents that are professionals or semiprofessionals and and uh very interested in their education But uh I think in the last year Im not if Im not mistaken in four of the six high schools the graduating class valedictorian and salutatorian were uh alm- half or more Oriental
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And you know theyre just extremely bright kids And also they value learning
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I was going to say Im not - I I would guess that its not that they are any brighter but they just maybe work harder or -
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well I I think things come easy for them too But I do think that they have that work ethic that we somehow have missed the boat in with lot of kids in the United States I dont they uh dont want to work for anything They want it to come to them but and be there but they dont want to work hard And these kids work really hard
turns.label: sv

turns.text: but maybe part of thats the problem that here weve weve let this value slip
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah I know I agree with that
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And they need to have some competition
turns.label: sv

turns.text: But what I see is - - the competition is there but instead of meeting the challenge theyre starting to resent them
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And its causing you know I think some some problems
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Because we see lot of racial problems in Dal- the Dallas area anyway
especially in Dallas And its mainly Black and and and Hispanic

But uh there is some there has been some resentment with Orientals in the Black community because theyve started businesses there and the Blacks resent them coming in and taking their money and theres been some violence because of it
turns.label: sd

turns.text: It is Its it is very sad
turns.label: aa

turns.text: So you know I really - I Ive Ive always prided myself on not being prejudiced and being you know uh welcome welcoming everyone --
-- that wants to come here And even when I was younger wh- when I was in college I was member of the because I lived up north and I was very into that the human rights part of everything
But I Ive Ive become very cynical --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- in the last three four years living in Texas
Well and it sounds like you feel that there is need for change Maybe the uh you know the - - there is too big of concentration coming all at once to to allow for adequate melting into the society
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh uh-huh Well and exactly thats exactly true Plus the fact that these people do come for short period of time Two two three four maybe five years and then go back And pick our brains which is wonderful and take all that back with them And and uh plus lot of American dollars But in in the long run maybe thats going to make better world too
turns.label: aa

turns.text: You know you just dont know
turns.label: sv

turns.text: An- - and yet you know with uh with uh - theres somebody on my other line but Im going to ignore --
-- that Uh anyway I just - you you kind of you don- you really dont know what to do And and I dont - I want my kids to have values where theyre accepting and so forth
And both of my children are really tol- more tolerant of Blacks and - Hispanics than they are of the Orientals
turns.label: sd

turns.text: for some reason They feel you know like theyve taken over They feel like uh you know theyre taking some of the the rewards that they should have
And I really dont want that to happen
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I think lot of their friends feel the same way too
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So and I really do wish I knew about quotas and really wish I - I really do wish I I knew more about immigration laws because I have no idea any more
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I would I would suspect that they have Well I guess um I dont have much much more to contribute to the topic
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Yeah I dont really either I wish I knew more
turns.label: b

turns.text: Probably if I did I might be little bit more uh tolerant
turns.label: sv

turns.text: perhaps And I - and even if I I really wish I knew the situations they were going back to or coming from
You dont know any of that and you feel you know you cant put yourself in their shoes or really understand them
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Unless - and for some reason Orientals are very uh - my good friend calls them pushy but I call them very that - they know what they want and they go get it
-- and so forth its wh- - pardon me
Yeah But in stores and things sometimes they can be very impolite because they can they get in front of you --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- or they uh they take something that you had in mind to get before you did You know just going for it they take it quickly
And uh they dont think anything of that And I dont you know - thats makes people resentful too And so
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And yet they have they have right to be here and I know that
But its it sometimes its gets touchy
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So and Im sure its lot different youre from Maryland
turns.label: sd

turns.text: You said What part of Maryland are you from
Oh okay My sister used to live there
turns.label: bk

turns.text: in that area And I Im sure that its lot different there Uh its lot different in I- than in Iowa than it is here
Well no I think I think there as I recall in my sons class there were were an awfu- an awful lot of mi- minorities
turns.label: ar

turns.text: And uh of all of all varieties And with the same you know some of the some of the same problems that youve mentioned But uh I dont know I guess I wasnt involved enough to to uh really stop to think about it

uh-huh Well I you know since I teach I see th- see it And and I feel - and I love the example that most of these children give the our American children And yet you know I can see why some of the parents are fear- that are fearful too
turns.label: b

turns.text: And and its kind of touchy situation
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I wish that we could all just learn from each other and not feel threatened But --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well it was good talking to you
turns.label: fc

turns.text: It was good to talk to to you too
turns.label: fc^m

turns.text: And have good trip in California
turns.label: fc
